titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

titles.ar: بَابُ اسْتِوَاءِ الْعَمَلِ وَ الْمُدَاوَمَةِ عَلَيْهِ
titles.en: Chapter 41 – Regularity of the deed and the persistence upon it

titles.ar: بَابُ اسْتِوَاءِ الْعَمَلِ وَ الْمُدَاوَمَةِ عَلَيْهِ
titles.en: Chapter 41 – Regularity of the deed and the persistence upon it

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا كَانَ الرَّجُلُ عَلَى عَمَلٍ فَلْيَدُمْ عَلَيْهِ سَنَةً ثُمَّ يَتَحَوَّلُ عَنْهُ إِنْ شَاءَ إِلَى غَيْرِهِ وَ ذَلِكَ أَنَّ لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ يَكُونُ فِيهَا فِي عَامِهِ ذَلِكَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ أَنْ يَكُونَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When the man was upon a (particular) deed, so let him persist upon it for a year. Then he should change from it, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Willing, to something else, and that is because the Night of Pre-determination (Laylat Al-Qadr) would occur in it during that year of his. Whatever Allah<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires would transpire’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ أَحَبُّ الْأَعْمَالِ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مَا دَاوَمَ عَلَيْهِ الْعَبْدُ وَ إِنْ قَلَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, from Zurara, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The most Beloved of the deeds to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic is what the servants persists upon, and even though it may be little’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ نَجَبَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْ عَمَلٍ يُدَاوَمُ عَلَيْهِ وَ إِنْ قَلَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Isa Bin Ayoub, from Ali Bin Mahziyar, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Muawiya Bin Ammar, from Najbat, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is none from the things more Beloved to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic than a (good) deed persisted upon, and even though it may be little’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( صلوات الله عليه )  يَقُولُ إِنِّي لَأُحِبُّ أَنْ أُدَاوِمَ عَلَى الْعَمَلِ وَ إِنْ قَلَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Muawiya Bin Ammar, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘Ali<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> was saying: ‘I<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> love to persists upon the (good) deed, and even though it may be little’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( صلوات الله عليه )  يَقُولُ إِنِّي لَأُحِبُّ أَنْ أَقْدِمَ عَلَى رَبِّي وَ عَمَلِي مُسْتَوٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Al A’ala, from Muhammad Bin Muslim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> love to go forward to my<sup>asws</sup> Lord<sup>azwj</sup> and my<sup>asws</sup> deed is regular’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَفْرِضَ عَلَى نَفْسِكَ فَرِيضَةً فَتُفَارِقَهَا اثْنَيْ عَشَرَ هِلَالًا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Ja’far Bin Bashir, from Abdul Kareem Bin Amro, from Suleyman Bin Khalid who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Beware, if you have imposed upon yourself an Obligation, so you separate (not perform) it for twelve crescents’.
